original_solution_mapping.L1: It takes 10 minutes to wash 4 windows and he has 64 windows so that breaks down to 64/4 = 16 units
original_solution_mapping.L2: It takes 10 minutes to wash a unit of windows and he has 16 units so 10*16 = <<10*16=160>>160 minutes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 382.
    Returns: the total number of minutes it will take David to wash all windows.
    """
    # L1
    total_windows = 64 # David's house has 64 windows
    windows_per_unit = 4 # wash 4 windows
    number_of_units = total_windows / windows_per_unit

    # L2
    minutes_per_unit = 10 # It takes David 10 minutes
    total_minutes = minutes_per_unit * number_of_units

    # FA
    answer = total_minutes
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: It takes 10 minutes to wash 4 windows and he has {total_windows} windows so that breaks down to {total_windows}/{windows_per_unit} = {number_of_units} units

It takes {minutes_per_unit} minutes to wash a unit of windows and he has {number_of_units} units so {minutes_per_unit}*{number_of_units} = <<{minutes_per_unit}*{number_of_units}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: It takes 10 minutes to wash 4 windows and he has 64 windows so that breaks down to 64/64 = 1 units
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It takes 10 minutes to wash a unit of windows and he has 1 units so 10*1 = <<10*1=10>>10 minutes

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_windows' (64) was used instead of 'windows_per_unit' (4).
